metadata.title: CVE-2022-20423 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In rndis_set_response of rndis.c, there is a possible out of bounds writedue to an integer overflow. This could lead to local escalation ofprivilege if a malicious USB device is attached with no additionalexecution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed forexploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID:A-239842288References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-20423` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-184-generic - 4.15.0-184.194
linux-image-4.15.0-184-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-184.194
linux-image-4.15.0-184-lowlatency - 4.15.0-184.194

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-184.194').
